abstract.text: Adds a buffer to the buffer queue of a recording or playback audio queue.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The audio queue that owns the audio queue buffer.
The audio queue buffer to add to the buffer queue.
The number of packets of audio data in the
parameter. Use a value of
for any of the following situations:
When playing a constant bit rate (CBR) format.
When the audio queue is a recording (input) audio queue.
When the buffer you are reenqueuing was allocated with the
function. In this case, your callback should describe the buffer’s packets in the buffer’s
and
fields.
An array of packet descriptions. Use a value of
for any of the following situations:
When playing a constant bit rate (CBR) format.
When the audio queue is an input (recording) audio queue.
When the buffer you are reenqueuing was allocated with the
function. In this case, your callback should describe the buffer’s packets in the buffer’s
and
fields.
A result code. See Result Codes.
Audio queue callbacks use this function to reenqueue buffers—placing them “last in line” in a buffer queue. A playback (or
output
) callback reenqueues a buffer after the buffer is filled with fresh audio data (typically from a file). A recording (or
input
) callback reenqueues a buffer after the buffer’s contents were written (typically to a file).

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Asks an audio queue object to allocate an audio queue buffer.
Asks an audio queue object to allocate an audio queue buffer with space for packet descriptions.
A pointer to an audio queue buffer.
Adds a buffer to the buffer queue of a recording or playback audio queue.
Adds a buffer to the buffer queue of a playback audio queue object, specifying start time and other settings.
Asks an audio queue to dispose of an audio queue buffer.
Defines an opaque data type that represents an audio queue.
A value that describes a packet in a buffer of audio data.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
